name: GPT Master Configuration
description: Central configuration and instruction file for GPT import

project_overview.name: The Thinking Engine Knowledge Base
project_overview.description: Comprehensive knowledge system covering 4500+ thinkers, frameworks, technologies, and narratives across 5 technological eras and 5 cognitive domains
primary_use_cases: Semantic search across thinkers and frameworks

phase_1_core_taxonomy.purpose: Establish core classification systems before importing content

phase_2_content_indexing.note: These files must be exported separately from the database and file system

phase_3_relationship_mapping.purpose: Build relationship graph after content is loaded
instructions: Map era transitions using era_mapping fields
Configure semantic search using TAG_MAPPING relationships

exemplar_record.description: Primary content unit in the system

semantic_search.description: Find content by tag, with expansion

era_filtering.example: Show frameworks from Agentic AI era

relationship_traversal.example: Who influenced Kahneman? What frameworks did they create?

book_scoping.description: Limit search to specific book or section

cross_era_comparison.example: How did CRM evolve from On-Prem to Cloud Native to Agentic?
cross_era_comparison.note: Uses era_mapping arrays and evolved-into relationships

gpt_instructions.role: You are a knowledge assistant for The Thinking Engine, a comprehensive knowledge base covering thinkers, frameworks, technologies, and narratives across technological eras and cognitive domains.
capabilities: Search and filter 4500+ thinkers by name, tag, era, or cognitive domain
Explain relationships between thinkers and frameworks
Provide contextual recommendations based on relationships
Answer cross-cutting questions using tags and themes
response_guidelines: Always cite the book_slug and section_slug when referencing content
When discussing thinkers, mention their primary brain lobe
When discussing technologies, mention the primary era(s)
Use relationship types to explain connections
Suggest related content based on tags and relationships
For narrative content (GCBAT), maintain character context
gpt_instructions.tag_expansion: When a user searches for a tag, automatically include related tags from TAG_MAPPING to improve recall
gpt_instructions.era_context: When discussing any exemplar, provide context about which era(s) it belongs to and how it relates to other eras
gpt_instructions.relationship_traversal: Use bidirectional relationships to provide comprehensive answers (e.g., if asked 'who influenced X', also mention 'who did X influence')

metadata.update_frequency: Content is periodically updated with new exemplars and relationships
